ygData.messageBody:
I must admit there are few good piercing weapons that bards can use dispite
having the piercing skill. I currently wield the following weapons:

Staff of Wriggling
Obscene Scimitar
Obscene Shard
Dragoon Dirk

As my piercing skill is not maxxed yet (it's in the 120's) I alternate
between weapons depending on the situation, so if I am in a group of 6 that
are doing fine I whack the piercers in, if it gets hairy I swap back again.
I am only doing this so that I can eventually dual wield the Staff and
shard (Proc's galore). The Dirk stays in my range slot unless I am
practicing piercing.
What we need is a top quality piercer that is better that the shard, ok the
shard is a good weapon but I find it gets resisted far too much, in Cazic
it has a 40% resist rate, don't know if this is because my skill is not
high enough or what but it's not great. And 30 dmg isn't a great deal
considering a monk can kick for 80+ every 5-10 seconds. I prefer the look
when I dual wield piercers though, the so called ugly stick and simitar are
well out of proportion for a small woodelf bard.

The only good piercing weapon I know of is from the Plains, I believe it is
the Martune Rapier???

Bards/Rogues are similar classes so I don't see why they can't let us wield
the same weapons. However I can understand Rogues getting more choice of
weapons as they do not have the choice of any other weapon skills.

Madagan Sonweaver, Bard of 33 Songs - Veeshan

From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>

Here is a semi-related topic from this thread. I was thinking about
including a condensed version of it in my post I intend to write as part of
the "ArchMage answers everything bards want to know" thread on the official
EQ board.

If you go to any of the EQ spoiler sites and look at all the piercing
weapons in the game, you'll see that a lot of them are Rogue only. Now I'm
a firm believer that every class should have weapons that only they can
wield, but it seems to me there are a disproportionate number of rogue only
piercing weapons in the game compared to the actual number of people who
play rogues. Lets also take into account how many classes actually use
piercing weapons. Other than rogues, bards are about the only other class
in the game that equip piercing weapons on a regular basis. A ranger here
and there may use them but most rangers I see use 1HS weapons. You almost
never any other class using them.

What I would like to see is either: 1) some of the rogue only piercing
items
changed to where bards can equip them or 2) more piercing weapons
(appropriate for 25-35 level characters) added to the game that a bard can
equip. The counter argument is that bards have a wide variety of 1HS, 1HB
and piercing weapons already in the game that they can use. True. But
since bards and rogues traditionally resemble one another, IMO it only
makes
sense that we can both use the same weapons. Also, a lot of bards,
especially those who are wood elves, have a very low Stamina stat. As a
result, I prefer to wield light weapons with fast Delay rates to avoid the
stamina drain. Most piercing weapons fall into this category.

Am I smoking crack here thinking there aren't enough medium level piercing
weapons in the game for bards to use?

Galtin of E'ci (still wielding a dragoon dirk since around 10th level)
30 bard
